item.title: The Brachycerus used as a means of cure for little children; the same insect not used again when another child is ill
item.summary: A ceremony performed with the Brachycerus (African Ground Weevil) in order to preserve young babies from convulsions. In the Katkop dialect by Díä!kwãin (L V.-23. 5833-5840) The Brachycerus used to cure illness in little children. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-21. 7822-7825). The !nu !nurussi (or Brachycerus, or African ground weevil) eats the child's illness.
item.comments: 1) |han≠kass'o heard this from his mother (|xabbi-an) and observed it himself, 2) This story is found in Book VIII-21
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
